data.quote: I do what is mine to do; the rest doesn't disturb me.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: You could leave life right now. Let that determine what you do and say and think.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: If it doesn't harm your character, how can it harm your life?
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: Forget everything else. Keep hold of this alone and remember it: Each of us lives only now, this brief instant. The rest has been lived already, or it is impossible to see.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: Stop drifting. Sprint for the finish. Write off your hopes, and if your wellbeing matters to you, be your own savior while you can.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: No random actions, none not based on underlying principles
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: Disturbance comes only from within-- from our own preceptions.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: The world is nothing but change. Our life is only preception
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: Chose not to be harmed-- and you won't feel harmed. Don't feel harmed-- and you haven't been.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: It can ruin your life only if it ruins your character. Otherwise it cannot harm you-- inside or out.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: It was for the best. So Nature had no choice but to do it.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: Is an emerald suddenly flawed if no one admires it?
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: While you are alive and able-- be good.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: Not to be driven this way and that, but always to behave with justice and see things as they are.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: Life is short. That is all there is to say.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: Ask yourself at every momemt, 'Is this neccessary?'
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: You're better off not giving the small things more time than they deserve.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: Hand yourself over to Clotho (Fate) voluntarily, and let her spin you into whatever she pleases.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: A little wisp of soul carrying a corpse.
data.author: Epictetus

data.quote: In short, know this: Human lives are brief and trivial. Yesterday a blob of semen; tomorrow embalming fluid, ash. To pass through this brief life as nature demands. To give it up without complaint. Like an olive that ripens and falls.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius
